abstract: One of Spain's most popular holiday events, the colorful Procession of the Three Kings, will proceed down the Paseo de la Castellana from Nuevos Ministerios to Plaza de Cibeles on Friday between 6:30 p.m. and 9 p.m.
lead_paragraph: One of Spain's most popular holiday events, the colorful Procession of the Three Kings, will proceed down the Paseo de la Castellana from Nuevos Ministerios to Plaza de Cibeles on Friday between 6:30 p.m. and 9 p.m. It features the elaborately dressed kings, their pages and helpers, who ride on floats distributing sweets to the children lining the route. There are at least 30 carriages, theatrical re-enactments, dancers, musicians, jugglers, street performers, royal pages, giant puppets and many other entertaining characters.According to the Bible, at this time of year, three wise and powerful kings brought gifts of gold, frankincense and myrrh to the infant Jesus. To celebrate the occasion, on Jan. 5, children in Spain go to bed early, awaiting the morning, when they hope to find the presents that they requested of the three kings in letters written on Boxing Day, Dec. 26. They leave shoes on windowsills or balconies or under the Christmas tree to be filled with toys.

headline.main: Madrid to Celebrate Three Kings, and the Gift of Innocence
